intro: Sedum altissimum var. latifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its fleshy, upright stems and broad, oval-shaped leaves that are typically covered in a waxy coating. The plant produces clusters of star-shaped, yellow flowers during the summer months, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a hardy choice for rock gardens and alpine settings. Its drought tolerance and ability to form dense mats make it an excellent ground cover in arid environments.
